snippet: With lawmakers at home for a recess, constituents are venting their anger over delays in enacting a new five-year farm bill.
abstract: Farmers across the heartland, and in particular in central Iowa, are complaining loudly over delays in enacting a federal five-year farm bill; with big disagreements in Congress over specific provisions of the bill, farmers are finding it difficult to plan for any recovery in the next growing season, and short-term drought relief passed in bill's stead has provided minimal respite (Series: In Full Swing).
lead_paragraph: With lawmakers at home for a recess, constituents are venting their anger over delays in enacting a new five-year farm bill.

headline.print_headline: Farmers in a Drought Try Doing Something About Congress
headline.seo: Drought-Driven Voters Vent Anger Over Farm Bill
headline.main: Enduring Drought, Farmers Draw the Line at Congress
